entry.title: Revolutionizing Refrigeration with AI Hybrid Cooling and Peltier Effect
entry.content:
The evolution of refrigeration technology has been a cornerstone of innovation in the home appliance industry. From traditional compressor systems to AI-driven hybrid cooling, Samsung has once again revolutionized the market with the integration of Peltier effect technology. This innovation delivers groundbreaking advancements in energy efficiency, temperature control, and environmental sustainability, enhancing the overall consumer experience.

The Peltier Effect: A Thermoelectric Phenomenon

Discovered in 1834 by French physicist Jean Charles Athanase Peltier, the Peltier effect describes a thermoelectric phenomenon where the junction of two different conductors or semiconductors absorbs heat on one side (cooling) and releases it on the other (heating) when an electric current flows through it.

Cooling Process

â€¢	Heat Absorption at the Cold Side: When current flows through a Peltier module, the cold side absorbs heat, cooling the air inside the refrigerator.
â€¢	Heat Dissipation at the Hot Side: The hot side expels the absorbed heat into the external environment through heat sinks or fans.

Temperature Control

â€¢	Precision Regulation: Adjusting the electric current allows for precise temperature control, making Peltier modules ideal for temperature-sensitive storage applications.

Environmental Benefits

â€¢	No Refrigerants Needed: Peltier cooling operates solely on electronic transfer, eliminating the need for traditional refrigerants like Freon, making it environmentally friendly and pollution-free.

Samsungâ€™s Innovation in AI Hybrid Cooling

Samsungâ€™s AI Hybrid Cooling technology masterfully combines traditional compressor systems with Peltier modules, optimized through AI algorithms to balance performance and energy efficiency.
1. Synergy Between Compressor and Peltier Modules
â€¢ The AI inverter compressor operates as the primary cooling system during normal conditions, ensuring low energy consumption.
â€¢ The Peltier module activates during peak cooling demands, such as when the door opens, delivering rapid and precise cooling to restore the internal environment.
2. AI-Driven Optimization
â€¢ Leveraging AI algorithms, the system dynamically adjusts operations based on user habits, such as door-opening frequency or restocking times, maintaining an ideal temperature consistently.
3. Improved Storage Efficiency and Capacity
â€¢ With no moving parts, the Peltier module frees up more internal space, increasing refrigerator capacity by 25 liters while also reducing operational noise.

Benefits for Consumers

Precise Temperature Control and Extended Freshness

The Peltier moduleâ€™s precise temperature regulation significantly extends food freshness. Tests have shown meat stays fresh 1.4 times longer and fish 1.2 times longer compared to traditional refrigerators, catering to consumers who value quality food preservation.

Energy Savings and Cost Reduction

By delegating high-load cooling tasks to the Peltier module, the compressor experiences less strain, reducing overall energy consumption and lowering maintenance costs.

Sustainability and Environmental Impact

Samsungâ€™s AI Hybrid Cooling technology addresses global energy efficiency and sustainability goals by reducing reliance on traditional refrigerants and optimizing energy use. This innovation supports environmentally conscious living while minimizing the productâ€™s carbon footprint.

Looking Ahead: The Future of AI and Thermoelectric Cooling

The launch of Samsungâ€™s AI Hybrid Cooling technology not only redefines the standards of refrigeration but also sets a template for smart upgrades in other home appliances. Combining the Peltier effect with AI technology is a significant step towards intelligent and sustainable refrigeration.

As consumer demand for energy efficiency, precise temperature control, and sustainability grows, AI Hybrid Cooling is poised to become the industry standard. Samsung has undoubtedly set a commendable benchmark through its technological innovation, leading the way in shaping smarter, more sustainable homes.

entry.title: Beko Unveils New Interactive Online Training Platform for Retailers

As a digital resource hub, Beko Learning Academy aims to enhance the professionalism of retail staff, enabling them to confidently communicate the value of Beko appliances to customers and thereby optimizing the overall shopping experience. The platform offers a diverse range of training courses, including interactive lessons, thorough product deep dives, and essential consumer insights, all customizable to individual learning preferences.

Whether you have a few minutes between customers or wish to dive deep into product specifics, this platform makes learning effortless and efficient.â€
Retail staff can join Beko Learning Academy by contacting their Beko account manager and following the enrollment procedure. To incentivize participation, the platform offers a special reward during the launch period: those who complete three training modules will receive a unique gift.

entry.title: Samsung Unveils New Refrigerator Lineup: 9-inch Integrating Screens and Enhanced AI Vision Features
entry.content:
Release Date: March 24, 2025

On March 24, 2025, Samsung Electronics unveiled its new lineup of smart refrigerators, continuing its â€œScreens Everywhereâ€ vision presented at CES 2025. The new series includes 9-inch AI home screens on four-door, French-door, and side-by-side refrigerators, and enhanced Family Hub screens on select models. Additionally, the new refrigerators feature an upgraded AI Vision Inside function, allowing better food recognition to optimize usersâ€™ kitchen experiences.

Key Product Descriptions and Features

1. 9-inch AI Home Screen


The 9-inch AI home screen on the new series enhances usersâ€™ food management, home control, communication, and entertainment experiences. With the AI Vision Inside function, the screen recognizes 37 food types, including fresh and processed items. Personalized recipe suggestions and meal planning simplify cooking. The screen also provides smart home control, allowing users to manage other connected devices through the SmartThings app. The Daily Board feature displays schedules, weather forecasts, and daily energy consumption reports, helping users organize their day-to-day activities.

2. Family Hub Large Screen

Select French-door and side-by-side models come with either a 32-inch or 21.5-inch Family Hub screen. This screen integrates the upgraded AI Vision Inside function, recognizing more food types and providing personalized recipes and meal suggestions. Users can also access the SmartThings app through the screen to control other smart devices in the home. The Daily Board function is also available on the Family Hub, providing real-time updates and information.

3. AI Vision Inside Function

The upgraded AI Vision Inside function enables the fridge to recognize up to 37 food types, including fresh and processed items. Users can store common food items for easier management and planning. This intelligent recognition feature provides personalized recipe and meal planning recommendations, improving the kitchen experience.

4. Innovative AI Hybrid Cooling Technology

The new refrigerator series features AI Hybrid Cooling Technology, combining the traditional compressor with the Peltier module to provide an intelligent cooling solution. This hybrid system ensures the fridge maintains a consistent temperature, even when there is a significant change in internal temperature, or when large quantities of groceries are added. The Peltier module assists the compressor when frequent door openings or high temperatures occur, ensuring optimal cooling performance, keeping food fresh for longer, and maximizing available space.

5. AI Energy Mode

The new refrigerators come with AI Energy Mode, allowing users to optimize energy consumption. This mode can reduce electricity use by up to 10%. Users can activate it continuously or during periods when electricity bills are expected to exceed a predefined threshold, providing better energy efficiency and cost savings.

Additional Features and Benefits

  • Smart Home Integration: The new refrigerators are deeply integrated with Samsungâ€™s SmartThings ecosystem, allowing users to control other smart devices in their homes, such as lights and outlets, through the fridge.

  • Daily Board Feature: The Daily Board on the fridgeâ€™s screen displays schedules, weather forecasts, and daily energy consumption reports, helping users stay organized.

  • Bixby Voice Assistant: Users can control the fridge and other connected devices via voice commands using the Bixby assistant, enhancing convenience.

Conclusion

Samsungâ€™s new smart refrigerator lineup integrates advanced screen technology, AI features, AI Hybrid Cooling, and AI Energy Mode to offer users an enhanced, intelligent kitchen experience. Whether itâ€™s food management, home control, or entertainment, these refrigerators demonstrate Samsungâ€™s innovation and leadership in the smart home space.

entry.title: Hisense HRCD640 Series: The Perfect Harmony of Dual Ice Technology and Energy Efficiency
entry.content:
In the competitive world of home appliances, the Hisense HRCD640 Series stands as a testament to cutting-edge innovation, elegant design, and user-centric functionality. Launched in Australia on September 30, 2024, this series marks a milestone as Hisenseâ€™s first-ever Dual Ice Maker refrigerator, offering unmatched flexibility and convenience. Available in three stunning versions, the HRCD640TBW (Dual Ice Maker + Finish Dark Stainless Steel), HRCD640TSW (Dual Ice Maker + Stainless Steel), and the HRCD640BW (Dark Stainless Steel base model), this range caters to diverse lifestyle needs.

Unparalleled Ice-Making Capabilities

The HRCD640TBW and HRCD640TSW models bring the luxury of Dual Ice Makers, capable of producing two types of iceâ€”cubed and nuggetâ€”simultaneously. Whether youâ€™re hosting a party or preparing refreshing drinks for the family, these refrigerators ensure you never run out of ice. With UV Water Treatment Technology, the water and ice you consume are purified to eliminate 99.99% of bacteria, offering clean, safe hydration without the need for replaceable filters.

Space That Fits Your Lifestyle

At 640L capacity, the HRCD640 Series offers ample room for every grocery need. Its four-door design ensures you can organize and access your items effortlessly, while features like the Sliding Shelf and Cantilever Shelves provide customizable storage for tall bottles, layered cakes, or large pots. Gone are the days of constant rearrangingâ€”this refrigerator adapts to you, not the other way around.

Customizable Zones for Freshness

The My Fresh Choice Zone takes versatility to the next level, allowing you to switch between fridge and freezer modes with temperatures ranging from -20Â°C to +5Â°C. This flexibility ensures your food stays fresh and flavorful, no matter its storage requirements. The Triple Temperature Zone further prevents odour mixing between compartments, keeping your ingredients fresher for longer.

Energy Efficiency with Style

All models in the HRCD640 Series boast an impressive 4.5-star energy rating, making them as efficient as they are stylish. Incorporating inverter technology and vacuum insulation panels, these refrigerators consume minimal energy while delivering whisper-quiet performance.

Smart Living at Your Fingertips

With ConnectLife App integration, managing your refrigerator has never been easier. Adjust temperature settings, monitor food freshness, and control your appliance remotelyâ€”whether youâ€™re at home or on the go.

Elegant Design That Enhances Any Kitchen

The HRCD640 Series combines premium flat door design, recessed handles, and high-quality finishes in Dark Stainless Steel or Stainless Steel, making it the centerpiece of any modern kitchen. This is a refrigerator that doesnâ€™t just store your foodâ€”it elevates your living space.

For those seeking an elegant yet practical solution, the HRCD640BW base model delivers the same luxurious design and spacious storage without the dual ice-making or UV water treatment features, providing a more accessible price point while maintaining exceptional functionality.

Affordable Excellence

With prices starting at $2,099 for the HRCD640BW, and $2,499 for the HRCD640TBW and HRCD640TSW, the HRCD640 Series offers premium features at a competitive price.

Upgrade your home today with the Hisense HRCD640 Series, where cutting-edge technology meets timeless elegance.

entry.title: Midea Launches World's First Sideboard Refrigerator, Ushering in a New Era for Fridges
entry.content:
On March 21, 2025, at the Appliance & Electronics World Expo (AWE2025) in China, Midea, in collaboration with JD.com, unveiled the worldâ€™s first sideboard refrigerator, marking a new era in the refrigerator industry. With its ultra-thin 45cm depth and a spacious 427L capacity, this refrigerator is the first to bring fridge thickness into the â€œ4â€ era, completely revolutionizing traditional refrigerator design and filling a gap in kitchen and dining space scenarios.

AWE2025 Midea New Fridge Launch

Innovative Design Leading the Scene Revolution

Zhao Guoyao, Chief Product Expert at Mideaâ€™s Refrigerator Division, stated that as consumer lifestyles evolve, the use scenarios for refrigerators have expanded from traditional kitchens to living rooms and dining areas. However, traditional refrigerators, typically over 60cm thick, cannot seamlessly integrate with 45cm-deep sideboards, leading to inefficient space utilization and compromised aesthetics. To address this, Midea leveraged technological innovation to introduce this ultra-thin sideboard refrigerator, which not only solves spatial issues but also enhances the overall aesthetic of home interiors.

Technological Breakthroughs for Ultra-Thin, High-Capacity Design

To achieve the 45cm ultra-thin design, Midea implemented several technological innovations. First, by relocating components such as the air duct evaporator from the back of the refrigerator to the middle beam, significant space was freed up at the rear. Second, the use of self-developed environmentally friendly VIP insulation material reduced the foam layer thickness to one-third of that in conventional refrigerators, maintaining insulation performance while significantly decreasing the body thickness. Additionally, Midea pioneered a micro high-efficiency compressor, reducing its size by 30% while increasing freezing capacity by 33%, ensuring the refrigerator remains highly efficient despite its slim design.

Fine-Tuned Compartmentalization Enhances User Experience

Mideaâ€™s sideboard refrigerator not only breaks new ground in thickness and capacity but also innovates in compartmentalization. Equipped with the All-Space Flexible Storage Technology, the refrigerator features 16 scientifically divided compartments, providing users with detailed storage guidance. The innovative foldable shelves allow flexible storage for bottles of varying heights, further enhancing user convenience.

Smart Purification Ensures Food Safety

To ensure the safety of stored food, Mideaâ€™s sideboard refrigerator is equipped with PST+ Smart Purification Technology, capable of removing over 200 harmful substances, including bacteria specific to Chinese household refrigerators, broad-spectrum bacteria, viruses, ethylene, odors, pesticide residues, and mold. This seven-in-one purification system ensures that users can enjoy safer food storage.

Future Outlook: Continuous Innovation

Wang Zhe, Head of Preservation Technology at Mideaâ€™s Refrigerator Division, mentioned that Midea has filed 46 patents related to this product, ensuring a balance between ultra-thin design, high performance, and large capacity. Moving forward, Midea will continue to invest heavily in R&D, focusing on preservation, energy efficiency, and purification technologies. By leveraging its global production base and talent pool, Midea aims to strengthen its competitiveness in the refrigerator industry.

The launch of the sideboard refrigerator not only represents a differentiated new category in a mature market but also reflects Mideaâ€™s deep understanding of consumer needs and industry trends. As Chinese households increasingly demand integrated home solutions and enhanced user experiences, Midea is poised to lead the industryâ€™s innovative development through continuous technological and product advancements.

This press release highlights Mideaâ€™s groundbreaking sideboard refrigerator, emphasizing its innovative design, technological advancements, and future potential in the home appliance market.

entry.title: Open Ecosystem and AI Integration, LG Drives Smart Home Innovation
entry.content:
2024/12/18,LG Electronics has fully opened the API of its LG ThinQ platform, marking a new milestone in smart home innovation. By combining openness, artificial intelligence, and IoT technology, LG empowers developers to create personalized and intelligent living scenarios while offering multi-tiered solutions for individual users and enterprise partners.

  1. Empowering Developers with ThinQ API
    LG introduced a dedicated developer platform (smartsolution.developer.lge.com) offering two versions of the ThinQ API: for individual users and business partners. The individual version enables users to connect and control 26 types of LG AI appliances, including refrigerators and washing machines, via global smart home platforms like Home Assistant. This opens up infinite possibilities for personalized home automation scenarios.
    The business version focuses on residential and office building management. For example, residents can reserve shared laundry facilities through building management apps, while administrators can monitor environmental data using LGâ€™s sensor technology for rapid issue resolution. This toolkit brings efficiency and convenience to smart communities and workplaces, enhancing LGâ€™s competitiveness in the enterprise market.

  2. Expanding IoT Ecosystem Through Athom Acquisition
    LGâ€™s acquisition of Athom, a leading smart home platform company, extends its IoT connectivity capabilities. Athomâ€™s Homey platform supports over 50,000 IoT devices and offers approximately 1,000 apps for controlling products from brands like Philips and Aqara. By integrating Homeyâ€™s open ecosystem into the LG ThinQ On AI home hub, LG achieves broader device compatibility, creating a highly connected and intelligent home environment.

  3. AI and Open Ecosystems Enhance User Experience
    Through the ThinQ AI platform, LG is committed to building an AI-driven smart home. The system better understands user needs, offering solutions like space optimization and automated living scenarios. This not only elevates user experience but also positions LG appliances as key drivers in smart home ecosystems.

  4. Strategic Significance: A Future of Openness and Collaboration
    LGâ€™s strategy of opening the ThinQ API and integrating Athomâ€™s ecosystem represents a shift from closed-brand systems to cross-platform collaboration. Whether addressing personalized needs of smart home enthusiasts or enterprise applications, LGâ€™s strategy reflects deep market insights. By embracing openness, LG accelerates technological innovation while establishing a differentiated edge in the global market.

Conclusion

LGâ€™s ThinQ API opening and Athom acquisition bring new possibilities to the smart home sector. By integrating AI and IoT technologies, LG empowers developers to create smarter scenarios and meets diverse demands from personalization to enterprise-level applications. This strategy highlights LGâ€™s vision for the future of smart homes: human-centered, interconnected, and driven by openness, collaboration, and technology.

entry.title: The Rise of Home Appliance Leasingï¼šA Market Trend Analysis of LG and Samsung
entry.content:
In recent years, the home appliance industry has witnessed the rise of a new business model: home appliance leasing services. This paradigm shift from traditional product sales to subscription-based services aims to meet consumersâ€™ growing demand for flexibility and customization. Both LG Electronics and Samsung Electronics have actively promoted leasing services in 2023 and 2024, showcasing their market foresight and the potential of this emerging business model.

A manager explains the "AI Subscription Club" to visiting customers at the Samsung Store in Seocho-dong, southern Seoul. (Samsung Electronics)

Drivers of Home Appliance Leasing

  1. Flexibility and Cost Optimization:
    Appliance leasing reduces the upfront financial burden on consumers, especially in the high-cost smart appliance sector. LG and Samsungâ€™s rental plans allow monthly payments while offering product upgrades, maintenance, and repairs. This appeals particularly to consumers who want access to the latest technology without the hefty upfront cost.
  2. Market Competition and Profit Pressure:
    Price wars led by Chinese brands have squeezed profit margins in the traditional retail market. Leasing services enhance product value through added features like AI diagnostics and remote maintenance while bypassing hefty retailer commissions. LGâ€™s subscription business, for instance, boasts a profit margin of over 10%, compared to the 7% margin of its traditional business.
  3. Smart Home and Ecosystem Development:
    Leasing services also facilitate the creation of smart home ecosystems. LGâ€™s ThinQ platform offers personalized functionalities, while Samsungâ€™s SmartThings platform powers its AI Subscription Club. This not only integrates appliances into consumersâ€™ daily lives but also strengthens brand loyalty and engagement.

Future Trend Predictions

  1. Growth of the Subscription Economy:
    Inspired by subscription models popularized by Netflix and Spotify, home appliance leasing is gaining traction. By allowing flexible service terms and packages, consumers enjoy greater freedom while companies secure a steady revenue stream. LG and Samsungâ€™s global expansion plans into markets like Australia, Europe, and the US underscore the broad potential of this trend.
  2. Technological Innovation and Differentiation:
    As AI becomes more prevalent, smart appliances are evolving from standalone hardware to integrated service hubs. LGâ€™s washing machines, for example, use ThinQ to enable feature updates, while Samsungâ€™s AI Subscription Club offers detailed monthly diagnostics. These innovations elevate leasing from mere â€œrentingâ€ to high-value intelligent services.
  3. Intensified Competition and Diverse Needs:
    Competition between Samsung and LG in subscription services has intensified. Samsung has introduced One UI and AI subscription services, while LG continues to optimize WebOS and expand its subscription product portfolio. Future market dynamics may see even more personalized and value-added services, such as housekeeping subscriptions and grocery deliveries.

Potential Challenges

Despite its promising outlook, the leasing model carries risks. Firstly, it requires companies to invest more in logistics and maintenance, which could impact profit margins. Secondly, consumer concerns over data privacy might hinder the adoption of smart services. Lastly, balancing leasing services with traditional retail sales remains a challenge.

Conclusion

The appliance leasing services introduced by LG and Samsung are not just strategic adjustments but also innovative responses to market demand. With the growing popularity of the subscription economy, the widespread application of AI technology, and the proliferation of smart homes, home appliance leasing services are poised to become a mainstream trend in the future appliance market.
